results.title: Proximal renal tubular peptide catabolism, ammonia excretion and tubular injury in patients with proteinuria: before and after lisinopril.
results.text_hl: However, there are no data in man on the kinetics of proximal renal tubular protein catabolism or markers of @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@tubular injury@@@ before and after @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Rustom R, Grime JS, Costigan M, Maltby P, Hughes A, Shenkin A, Critchley M, Bone JM. Proximal renal tubular peptide catabolism, ammonia excretion and tubular injury in patients with proteinuria: before and after lisinopril. Clin Sci (Lond). 1998 Apr;94(4):425-30. PMID: 9640348
citations.BibTeX: @article{9640348, title={Proximal renal tubular peptide catabolism, ammonia excretion and tubular injury in patients with proteinuria: before and after lisinopril.}, author={Rustom R and Grime JS and Costigan M and Maltby P and Hughes A and Shenkin A and Critchley M and Bone JM}, journal={Clin Sci (Lond)}, volume={94}, number={4}, pages={425-30}}

results.title: Renal tubular peptide catabolism in chronic vascular rejection.
results.text_hl: We demonstrated in both @DISEASE_Nephrotic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D009404 @@@nephrotic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with normal function and in those with failing kidneys increased renal tubular catabolism and turnover rates of a peptide marker, Aprotinin (Apr), linked to increased @CHEMICAL_Ammonia @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000641 @@@ammonia@@@ excretion and @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@tubular injury@@@. These potentially injurious processes were suppressed by reducing @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Rustom R, Grime JS, Sells RA, Amara A, Jackson MJ, Shenkin A, Maltby P, Smith L, Hammad A, Brown M, Bone JM. Renal tubular peptide catabolism in chronic vascular rejection. Ren Fail. 2001 May-Jul;23(3-4):517-31. PMID: 11499566
citations.BibTeX: @article{11499566, title={Renal tubular peptide catabolism in chronic vascular rejection.}, author={Rustom R and Grime JS and Sells RA and Amara A and Jackson MJ and Shenkin A and Maltby P and Smith L and Hammad A and Brown M and Bone JM}, journal={Ren Fail}, volume={23}, number={3-4}, pages={517-31}}

results.title: Mesenchymal Stromal Cells Prevent Renal Fibrosis in a Rat Model of Unilateral Ureteral Obstruction by Suppressing the Renin-Angiotensin System via HuR
results.text_hl: Combined therapy provided a further suppression of monocyte infiltration and @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@tubular injury@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ alone caused a rebound activation of Renin-Angiotensin System (RAS), while MSC suppressed RENmRNA and @GENE_REN @GENE_24715 @@@Renin@@@ synthesis and induced a decrease of @GENE_AGT @GENE_24179 @@@AII@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Aldosterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000450 @@@aldosterone@@@ serum levels.

citations.NLM: Gregorini M, Corradetti V, Rocca C, Pattonieri EF, Valsania T, Milanesi S, Serpieri N, Bedino G, Esposito P, Libetta C, Avanzini MA, Mantelli M, Ingo D, Peressini S, Albertini R, Dal Canton A, Rampino T. Mesenchymal Stromal Cells Prevent Renal Fibrosis in a Rat Model of Unilateral Ureteral Obstruction by Suppressing the Renin-Angiotensin System via HuR PLoS One. 2016;11(2):e0148542. PMID: 26866372
